intro: Daucus subglaber, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, peppery scent when crushed. Daucus subglaber is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
